Sentence: Bill Shorten today failed to rule out increases in the cost of rental accommodation as a result of his ill-thought out changes to negative gearing arrangements.
Asked today to guarantee housing rents won't rise as a result of his housing tax he talked about everything except rental costs :
Question: The median house price in this suburb is $1.5 million.
The median rent per week is $700.
Can you guarantee your negative gearing policy won't push those rents up?
Bill Shorten: I can guarantee that our measures will give a better chance than currently exists for first homebuyers to enter the housing market.
(Opposition Leader press conference, Five Dock, Sydney, 13 May 2016)

As Australia’s leading real estate agents have confirmed today, Bill Shorten’s reckless policy on negative gearing will drive down the value of Australian homes - for many families their biggest asset and it will push up the cost of rental accommodation.
That is not what Australia needs.
We need more investment to increase the supply of housing and we need more investment to generate stronger growth and more jobs.
Labor has no plan for jobs and growth.
Labor just has a plan for higher taxes which would hurt jobs and growth.
